meta.description: Marhaba Lounge at Singapore Changi Airport (SIN), Terminal 1. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Marhaba Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Located directly above the Departure Immigration Area of the Departure Transit Hall. After Departure Immigration, turn right and take the escalator up one level. The lounge will be located across from the Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao Restaurant.

lounge.description: Modern comfort awaits at this Pan-Asian themed oasis with Peranakan Art and traditional Singaporean fare at the buffet. Each luxurious seating area comes with a universal multi-pin power socket for your convenience.

general: Children under 6 years old are admitted free with an adult.
Hudson Coffee baristas are on hand at certain hours.
warning: This lounge is accessible for Terminal 1, 2, and 3 passengers only.
Lounge may be busy from late afternoons until 10:30 pm. During this period, access for Priority Pass and other lounge membership cardholders may be restricted.

reviews.content: Relaxing layout. Reasonable but small selection of food and drinks. Given the cost of alcohol in Singapore it’s totally worth paying for access over a restaurant with alcohol.
My favourite lounge in T1. Bigger than most. The usual buffet, coffee, alcohol. A nice courtyard that some of the seats overlook.
T1 Early morning. No bar service, average food. Good location right above departure immigration.
Sat @ 7pm - Nice, sizeable lounge. Good selection of drinks & tasty food. Comfortable and quiet.
Poor shower rooms. Shampoo and shower gel are the same liquid and the AC does not work well at shower rooms. It's like a steam sauna. However, foods and drinks are average.
Construction going on adjacent to lounge on March 3rd at 1:00 am in the morning!
Super nice and friendly staff, always clean and a great food selection; I spent 4h there and every hour they served something different! Also many drinks to choose from. I would definitely recommend!
Stupid policy of not taking arriving passengers while my flight check in counter won’t open in the next 7hrs.
Good lounge with a great selection of food. Also a strong selection of drinks with 10 different spirits and 5 different wines available. Beers and soft drinks also available. There is a lot of space.
The lounge showers are clean and nice; however, that is about the only use in this lounge. Food terrible, wifi barely works. Not recommended.
They say they can refuse Priority Pass clients if they are too full. So be aware in case you plan to use PP. They may not let you in. There is nothing about this in the Priority Pass application.
Very helpful in getting access sorted, great staff.  Hot shower and very clean I would recommend.
Nice modern lounge. Plenty of quality foods to chose from. Lots of top shelf liquor. Showers were free & clean. Staff professional and polite. Great place to relax before your flight. Best lounge.
I arrived one evening having read the reviews and was looking forward to using this lounge, only to be told that Priority Pass members are not allowed entry between 1900 and 2200 as of yesterday.
Worth the detour on transit flights. Showers are good. Towels are provided. Decent food quality and staff very helpful.
Nice and quiet lounge. Food and drink is good and fresh. Staffs are friendly and willing to help. Overall is very satisfied.
Perfect place to relax before the flight. Great hot and cold food options. Very wide selection of drinks (2 red wines and 2 white). Free showers. Fast wifi.
Very clean lounge with nice options that add diff from most Sky Clubs and Centurion lounges. Very refreshing.
I prefer this to the QF lounge. Spotless, roomy showers, comfy chairs, and hardly anyone there. I enjoyed the food - MYO chicken rice, udon noodle soup etc. Good self-pour alcohol. I’ll be back.
Very poor food choices - JUST BAD QUALITY. Fake Orange Juice.. Just sugar soda! Can't believe Delta uses this lounge for business class travelers.
We saw some negative reviews but found no reason to complain. Food was good and plentiful, wine was good quality, it was spotless and staff were courteous and friendly. Loos clean. V happy.
This is best for relaxing with a drink. Solid free liquor, wine and beer.  Great barista coffee bar.  Loved the soy Cappuccino.  As long as you are not looking to sleep, you will love it.
Shower rooms have toilet and sink within. Better than SATS and Plaza Premium by far. Better food, free alcohol, better seating, quiet.
I know a lot of people don't use lounge showers, but the showers here are really great! On food, it had a great selection of Western-friendly Japanese food around midnight. I'd go again.
Tiene pollo frito. Fideos ajo y aceite y vs comidas mas. Agua grande unicamente. Cervezas japonesas y vietnamitas/ otras bebidas con y sin alcohol.
WiFi is terrible! The food is just OK! Not much options.. I don’t think I would come to this lounge again.

A cheap place to have a couple of drinks before your next flight. It’s moderate busy so if you want heaps of personal space don’t bother. Food is average. Decent enough for a shower. Wifi is slow 0.7mbps.
Average lounge. Basic spirits, at least it’s free (beware other Changi lounges charge!) hot food options limited. And some removed at 8pm.
Nice lounge for Priority Pass, food is so so but have good selection of drinks. Including beers wines and spirits. Comfortable seats and not too crowded.(weekday 16-1800)
Nice quiet place to relax in before a flight. Food and drinks are rather good.
This might be the best lounge I've been to. Chivas seemingly sponsors the joint and it's tucked away in a quiet corner making it perfect for a quick respite from the anxieties of flying.
Amazing. Very spacious, quiet, extensive self service bar drinks, great coffee machine, variety of cold and hot snacks including vegetarian options. 👌🏻👍🏻
It was early in the morning when I visited this lounge. It was nice, clean, and very quiet. Food options were typical for what you would find in any lounge.
Not a bad lounge to relax in. Food options are limited but still not bad. Didn't have any alcohol so not sure about paying, but the coffee machine pulled a decent long black.
The showers are a good size and clean, but the lounge is grimy and the food isn't great. Check-in service was a bit rude. Fast wifi though.
Meh. Very limited food options. No dessert.
Great value, clean, small selection of buffet food, good mags and newspapers, good selection of drinks including wine, beer and spirits. Coffee machine, no barista though.
Quiet and stylish lounge with nice seating. Food a little underwhelming. Proper food, but not huge variety, could do with some fruit. Good drinks options though and friendly staff.
Very comfortable lounge spotlessly clean with great food and drink options. Spacious with separate eating and relaxing/working areas. Very attentive service staff. All in all a very pleasant visit.
Quite, spacious. Wide choice of F&B, power points everywhere and USB power. Good experience.
Quiet. Spacious. Dimly lit. Set apart From the other lounges. Conducive to work. Moderately stocked free bar. Decent food in the evening.
Several buffet-style lunch options, great coffee bar and Chivas drinks.
Really nice food choices.  Very spacious seating area. Easy to find.
Very solid by Priority Pass standards and better than many alliance business class lounges. I had a great lunch even being vegetarian.
Not bad. Came @10pm on Tues. Food was pretty good, not too busy. Decent cheese and hummus spread. Loved the dim lighting. 4ms / 1mbps down/up (likely capped) to SG server.
Excellent lounge. Lots of seating, good food selection and premium drinks.
Decent, quiet. Good food. Lots of space. Very slow disappointing wifi.
Nice lounge that has a Hudson Coffee bar.
Peaceful and quiet, food is terrible.
Nice lounge with good food selection (breakfast). Lots of seating but the internet speeds are awful (1Mbps).
Very comfortable lounge with food, showers, comfy chairs, and a nice quiet atmosphere. Would definitely use this lounge again and recommend it to others.
Very basic - the lounges depicted in the pics are not those at the lounge today. Decent food - satay sticks & pasta + a make yourself Caesar salad that was good. Limited drinks (no alcohol).
Not bad, fairly elaborate food selection. Ample seating. Made note of 3 hour time limit when I checked in. Hard to imagine wanting to spend that long in that lounge!
Plenty of space for you to relax w/ nice chairs/couches; has bar areas and dining seating; food selection is standard, the wifi is good, plenty of drink options and the shower/bathroom setup is nice.
Modern design lounge with spacious chairs and couches. Good food, and in addition to this they offer Hudson coffee in the mornings and some evenings there is a Chivas cocktail specialist.
Love the in-house Coffeeshop by Hudson's Coffee of Melbourne. Love the ample & comfy seating. A very pleasant & homey atmosphere & interiors. One of the best lounge to go at SIN. A must to visit =)
Pretty much a lot more choices for alcoholic beverages than other lounges. Food options are good. Had a private seating area though. Visited July.
Not much going on here. Decent food, a lot of space to relax. There are much better lounges, but this is decent for Priority Pass access.
One of the better lounges that Singaporeans can get access with a credit card. Plenty of beautiful space but limited food options.

otherLounges.name: British Airways Singapore Lounge and Concorde Bar

location.terminalDirections: Turn left after Immigration, take the lift or escalator to Level 3.
Departure/Transit Lounge West, Level 3, above Gate C1.
Departure Transit Hall on Level 3 near Transfer C
After Immigration Control, turn left. Take the escalator opposite TWG Tea Boutique up to the lounge entrance on Level 2.
Located in the departure area above Boarding Gate C1.
Turn left after Passport Control, take the lift or escalator to Level 3.
